summary: This is a supplemental ex parte declaration by an FBI Special Agent in support of the United States' response to a motion to quash grand jury subpoenas (OLY-63 and OLY-64) in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The agent details new information from an interview with a girl recruited as a minor to provide massages and pose for nude photographs for Epstein, arguing the subpoenaed computers likely contain evidence of solicitation of minors and possibly child pornography.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure being investigated for solicitation of minors to engage in prostitution and lewd and lascivious conduct with minors. The declaration describes his interactions with a minor victim.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The author of the declaration. A Special Agent with the FBI's Miami Division, assigned as the case agent investigating Jeffrey Epstein. They located and interviewed a new victim.

connections.description: The Special Agent is the lead investigator assigned to the case against Jeffrey Epstein for solicitation of minors.

events.title: Recruitment and repeated visits of minor victim
events.description: A girl, age 14 in 2001, was recruited by another female to provide personal massages to Jeffrey Epstein at his Palm Beach home. She returned approximately 100 times between 2001 and 2003, with sexual behavior escalating. She was paid $200-$400 per massage.

events.title: Nude photo session of minor
events.description: When the victim was approximately 16, Epstein's assistant called her to arrange a photo session. She traveled to Epstein's home where he took a series of nude photographs of her on his property using a digital camera. She was paid $500.

events.title: Filing of Supplemental Declaration
events.description: The FBI Special Agent files this supplemental ex parte declaration to provide new victim testimony in support of the government's opposition to a motion to quash grand jury subpoenas for computers.

locations: 358 El Brillo Way, Palm Beach, Florida
Miami Division, Palm Beach County Resident Agency
keyFacts: A new minor victim was interviewed by the FBI case agent after the initial declaration was filed. She was 14 when recruited in 2001 and visited Epstein's Palm Beach home approximately 100 times between 2001-2003.
Epstein took a series of nude photographs of this victim when she was approximately 16 years old, using a digital camera, and paid her $500 for the session.
The agent states the computers subject to the grand jury subpoenas (OLY-63 and OLY-64) are likely to contain evidence of Epstein's solicitation of minors and may contain child pornography.
The declaration identifies the involvement of other individuals whose names are redacted: a recruiter (female, age 17 at the time), and Epstein's assistant who arranged the photo session.
This document is part of a sealed, ex parte legal proceeding where the government is fighting a motion to quash subpoenas for evidence.
